channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: COMIC: Exploring the ocean's wonderous, mysterious depths
item.description: Did you know that we know less about the sea than we do about space? With this comic, we explore some of what scientists do know about Earth's ocean.
item.content:encoded: Did you know that we know less about the sea than we do about space? With this comic, we explore some of what scientists do know about Earth's ocean.
item.dc:creator: Berly McCoy

item.title: The world keeps millions of vaccines on ice. Is it worth it?
item.description: It costs nearly $100 million a year to maintain global stockpiles of vaccines for Ebola, cholera, meningitis and yellow fever in case of emergency. A new study estimates how many lives they've saved.
item.content:encoded:
It costs nearly $100 million a year to maintain global stockpiles of vaccines for Ebola, cholera, meningitis and yellow fever in case of emergency. A new study estimates how many lives they've saved.

(Image credit: Namukolo Siyumbwa)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Harvard and Trump admin. face off in court. And, Texas seeks new congressional map
item.description: Harvard and the Trump administration are facing off in federal court today over the freezing of over $2 billion in grants and contracts. And, Texas lawmakers are seeking a new congressional makeup.
item.content:encoded:
Harvard and the Trump administration are facing off in federal court today over the freezing of over $2 billion in grants and contracts. And, Texas lawmakers are seeking a new congressional makeup.

(Image credit: Sophie Park/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: U.S. coffee drinkers and businesses will pay the price for Trump's Brazil tariffs
item.description: President Trump plans to levy a 50% tariff on all goods from Brazil — the source of about 30% of U.S. coffee imports. This looming tariff threat has sent shock waves through the U.S. coffee industry.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump plans to levy a 50% tariff on all goods from Brazil — the source of about 30% of U.S. coffee imports. This looming tariff threat has sent shock waves through the U.S. coffee industry.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Many beauty products have toxic ingredients. Newly proposed bills could change that
item.description: The "Safer Beauty Bill Package" would ban the most toxic ingredients in everyday cosmetics and create protections for the women of color and salon workers who are disproportionately exposed to them.
item.content:encoded:
The "Safer Beauty Bill Package" would ban the most toxic ingredients in everyday cosmetics and create protections for the women of color and salon workers who are disproportionately exposed to them.

(Image credit: Nadia Audigie)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Trump has a welcome message for new citizens. It's different from past presidents
item.description: Trump released his video message to newly naturalized citizens. He welcomes them to the "national family," adding that they have a responsibility to "fiercely guard" and preserve American culture.
item.content:encoded:
Trump released his video message to newly naturalized citizens. He welcomes them to the "national family," adding that they have a responsibility to "fiercely guard" and preserve American culture.

(Image credit: David L. Ryan)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Teens are trying to bulk up on protein supplements. What should parents watch for?
item.description: Teenage boys especially are getting lots of messages — from peers and from social media — about the power of protein supplements. Doctors caution there can be too much of a good thing.
item.content:encoded:
Teenage boys especially are getting lots of messages — from peers and from social media — about the power of protein supplements. Doctors caution there can be too much of a good thing.

(Image credit: Huizeng Hu/Moment RF)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: In the spotlight after floods, Texas lawmakers eye disaster plans amid FEMA uncertainty
item.description: The Legislature will look at proposals for emergency preparedness in a special session that was already planned over hemp laws. A bill to help build emergency systems failed in the spring.
item.content:encoded:
The Legislature will look at proposals for emergency preparedness in a special session that was already planned over hemp laws. A bill to help build emergency systems failed in the spring.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Blaise Gainey

item.title: Lawyers for Harvard and Trump square off in court in Boston
item.description: With more than $2 billion in federal research grants at stake, the two sides will argue before a federal judge as the university pushes back on the administration's demands.
item.content:encoded:
With more than $2 billion in federal research grants at stake, the two sides will argue before a federal judge as the university pushes back on the administration's demands.

(Image credit: Jesse Costa)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Ecuador extradites leader of violent Ecuadorian drug gang to the United States
item.description: José Adolfo Macías Villamar, whose nickname is "Fito," escaped from a prison in Ecuador last year and was recaptured late June. In April, a U.S. Attorney indicted him in New York City on charges he imported thousands of pounds of cocaine into the United States.
item.content:encoded:
José Adolfo Macías Villamar, whose nickname is "Fito," escaped from a prison in Ecuador last year and was recaptured late June. In April, a U.S. Attorney indicted him in New York City on charges he imported thousands of pounds of cocaine into the United States.

(Image credit: Ecuador's Ministry of Interior)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
